e.v: Func :©gdp_r(c,i,g,x,m): GDP by expenditure approach :Return c+i+g+x-m :EndFunc
Func :©rgdp(nom,def): real GDP from nominal and deflator :Return nom/def*100 :EndFunc
Func :©rinc(nom,cpi): real income adjusted for inflation :Return nom/(cpi/100) :EndFunc

wdgt.np:txt: \1keyword gdp_other\ \1keyword library\ \1keyword -\ \1keyword version\ \1keyword 1.0.0\ 2→\1subhead GDP\ \1subhead and\ \1subhead CPI\ \1subhead Formulas\ 3→\1subhead \ 4→\1keyword How\ \1keyword to\ \1keyword use\ \1keyword this\ \1keyword library\ 5→To use a function from this library, follow these steps: 6→1. Make sure the library document \1keyword gdp_other\ is in the \1keyword MyLib\ folder. 7→2. Press \1keyword [ctrl]\ \1keyword [home]\ and select \1keyword Refresh\ \1keyword Libraries\ . 8→3. Open the Calculator application. 9→4. Open the Catalog and use the library tab to find and insert the object. 10→ - or - 11→ Type the name of the object, such as \0el {gdp_other\gdp_r(100,50,30,40,20)}. To type the "\" character on the handheld, press [CAPS] [÷]. 12→5. If arguments are required, type them inside the parentheses. 13→ For example, \0el {gdp_other\cpi({5,10,10.5},{1,1,1.05},{5,3,3})} 14→

\1keyword gdp_other\ \1keyword library\ \1keyword -\ \1keyword version\ \1keyword 1.0.0\ 15→====================== 16→\1keyword TABLE\ \1keyword OF\ \1keyword CONTENTS\ 17→\1keyword \ 18→\1title Public\ \1title functions\ 19→\1title \ 20→\0el {version()} - returns library version 21→ Returns: \0el {"1.0.0"} 22→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\version()} 23→ 24→\0el {gdp_r(c,i,g,x,m)} - GDP by expenditure approach 25→ Formula: GDP = C + I + G + X - M 26→ Parameters: 27→ \1keyword c\ - consumption 28→ \1keyword i\ - investment 29→ \1keyword g\ - government spending 30→ \1keyword x\ - exports 31→ \1keyword m\ - imports 32→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\gdp_r(100,50,30,40,20)} → 200 33→ 34→\0el {ds(vyp,pp)} - added value (value added) 35→ Formula: DS = Output - Intermediate consumption 36→ Parameters: 37→ \1keyword vyp\ - gross output (revenue) 38→ \1keyword pp\ - intermediate consumption 39→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\ds(1000,600)} → 400 40→ 41→\0el {profit(vyr,syr,zp)} - firm profit 42→ Formula: Profit = Revenue - Costs - Wages 43→ Parameters: 44→ \1keyword vyr\ - revenue 45→ \1keyword syr\ - costs 46→ \1keyword zp\ - wages 47→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\profit(1000,600,200)} → 200 48→ 49→\0el {cpi(pn,p0,q)} - CPI Laspeyres index 50→ Formula: CPI = (SUM(pn*q) / SUM(p0*q)) * 100 51→ Parameters: 52→ \1keyword pn\ - list of current prices 53→ \1keyword p0\ - list of base year prices 54→ \1keyword q\ - list of base year quantities 55→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\cpi({5,10,10.5},{1,1,1.05},{5,3,3})} → 500 56→ 57→\0el {infl(cpi1,cpi0)} - inflation rate 58→ Formula: Inflation = ((CPI1 - CPI0) / CPI0) * 100% 59→ Parameters: 60→ \1keyword cpi1\ - current period CPI 61→ \1keyword cpi0\ - base period CPI 62→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\infl(110,100)} → 10 63→ 64→\0el {defl(nom,real)} - GDP deflator 65→ Formula: Deflator = (GDP_nominal / GDP_real) * 100 66→ Parameters: 67→ \1keyword nom\ - nominal GDP 68→ \1keyword real\ - real GDP 69→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\defl(110,100)} → 110 70→ 71→\0el {rgdp(nom,def)} - real GDP 72→ Formula: GDP_real = (GDP_nominal / Deflator) * 100 73→ Parameters: 74→ \1keyword nom\ - nominal GDP 75→ \1keyword def\ - GDP deflator 76→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\rgdp(110,110)} → 100 77→ 78→\0el {fisher(lasp,paas)} - Fisher price index 79→ Formula: I_F = SQRT(Laspeyres * Paasche) 80→ Parameters: 81→ \1keyword lasp\ - Laspeyres index 82→ \1keyword paas\ - Paasche index 83→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\fisher(110,105)} → 107.47 84→ 85→\0el {rinc(nom,cpi)} - real income 86→ Formula: Real Income = Nominal / (CPI/100) 87→ Parameters: 88→ \1keyword nom\ - nominal income 89→ \1keyword cpi\ - CPI index 90→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\rinc(1000,110)} → 909.09 91→ 92→\0el {pp(cpi)} - purchasing power 93→ Formula: PP = 100 / CPI 94→ Parameters: 95→ \1keyword cpi\ - CPI index 96→ Example: \0el {gdp_other\pp(110)} → 0.909 97→
